item.title: emoji_test
item.description: R Markdown Example You can either refer to emoji by their name (which is unique): emo::ji("poop") <U+0001F4A9> Or by a keyword. Keywords are not unique so emo::ji will pick one for you at random. emo::ji("face") <U+0001F635> emo::ji("face") <U+0001F486><U+200D>‚ôÄ<U+FE0F> emo::ji("face") <U+0001F981> Often you‚Äôll use inline like `r emo::ji("smile")` üòÑ Keywords These are all keywords with more than one emoji associated with them.

item.title: testpage
item.description: By default, the publish directory is the public/ directory. However, when hosting a website on GitHub, GitHub can only recognize website files within the docs/ folder. We need to change the default publish directory from public/ to docs/.
